title: Patriots could be facing off against their former 1st-round pick in Miami
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Miami Dolphins signed former Patriots lineman Cole Strange from Cleveland Browns’ practice squad.
Strange, a former first-round pick, had 29 starts for New England, hampered by injuries and underperformance.
Dolphins need Strange after guard James Daniels was injured, with potential lineup inclusion against Patriots.

title: Tufts to go tuition-free for families making less than $150K
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Tufts University will waive tuition for undergraduates from families earning under $150,000 starting next fall.
Families earning under $60,000 will receive financial aid packages without student loans at Tufts University.
Tufts aims to increase geographic diversity, particularly from the Southeast, through the new tuition-free program.

title: Aunt now caring for child of parents killed in Watertown murder-suicide
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: David Minasvand killed Nadia Abrahamian and Karine Asatryan before taking his own life in Watertown.
Karine Asatryan's 1-year-old daughter, Madeline, will be raised by her aunt, according to a fundraiser.
Over $37,000 has been raised to support Madeline's future needs including education and childcare.

title: What Don Sweeney said about the Bruins’ playoff odds, timeline for new captain
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Don Sweeney anticipates Boston Bruins will be competitive for the 2025-26 season, emphasizing health and a strong defensive identity.
The team will start the season without a designated captain, allowing leadership to develop organically, per Sweeney's comments.
Bruins aim to integrate younger talents and recent signings to bolster the roster for the upcoming NHL season.

title: These 5 New England restaurants make best 50 list from NYT
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Five New England restaurants made The New York Times' 50 best restaurants list, with two located in Boston.
McGonagle's in Dorchester and La Padrona in Back Bay represented Boston, highlighted for Irish and Italian cuisine.
Connecticut and Maine also featured with Haring’s and two Maine restaurants, but Rhode Island missed recognition this year.

title: Patriots reportedly cut ‘training camp star’ DJ James
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots waive second-year cornerback DJ James after he earned a roster spot with a standout preseason.
James, a 2024 sixth-round pick by Seattle, played limited snaps in the season opener against the Raiders.
Patriots' cornerback depth impacted with release amid Christian Gonzalez's absence due to a hamstring injury.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce may get married in Rhode Island. Here’s everything we know about the possible wedding plans.
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce plan to marry at Swift's Westerly, Rhode Island mansion by summer 2026.
The couple announced their engagement on Instagram with a large ring, following Kelce's proposal in August 2025.
Swift purchased the 11,000-square-foot mansion in 2013, and has undertaken significant renovations for privacy.

title: 2 cyclists medflighted after Mass. crashes
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 63-year-old female cyclist was medflighted after a collision with a car in Gloucester Monday morning.
A 15-year-old cyclist in Norwood was medflighted with nonlife-threatening injuries after a crash on Walpole Street.
Police report both incidents remain under investigation; the Gloucester driver was hospitalized and Norwood driver stayed on scene.

title: North Andover officer shot by colleague released from jail
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: North Andover officer Kelsey Fitzsimmons released from jail on house arrest, ordered no contact with her infant son.
Fitzsimmons charged with assault with a dangerous weapon after June 30 incident, pleads not guilty.
Her release requires GPS monitoring and living with her mother; incident involved restraining order due to fiancé's concerns.

title: N.H. woman indicted for allegedly distributing ‘animal crush’ videos
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lynn Seymour, 51, from Manchester, N.H., indicted on charges of distributing animal crush videos and conspiracy.
Seymour was released with conditions, including mental health program participation and no unauthorised electronic device use.
She faces up to seven years for distribution and five years for conspiracy, with fines up to $250,000.
